title: Jon Jones officially reinstated by the UFC
text:
Report an error 
The Ultimate Fighting Championship announced Friday that Jon Jones has been reinstated following “a review of the plea agreement” he reached with officials in Albuquerque. 
The former UFC light heavyweight champ had been suspended six months for his part in a hit-and-run accident in April. 
“Effective immediately, Jones is eligible to return to competition,” the UFC said in a statement. “As such, UFC expects Jones to meet all of the terms of his plea agreement, including mandatory community service, as a condition of his reinstatement. 
The UFC added it's currently discussing a date for Jones to return to the octagon. 
“I am thankful to be able to do what I love once again and I look forward to proving myself as a champion in and outside of the Octagon,” Jones said. 
Jones owns a career 21-1 record. 
His last fight occurred at UFC 182 last January when he beat Daniel Cormier via a decision.
